department.ch: 工業管理研究所碩士班

goal.en: "This course introduces fundamental topics in stochastic processes. These topics include renewal theory, Poisson processes, discrete time Markov chains, and continuous time Markov chains."
goal.ch: "This course introduces fundamental topics in stochastic processes. These topics include renewal theory, Poisson processes, discrete time Markov chains, and continuous time Markov chains."

content.en:
"1 Conditional probability and expectation
2 Markov Chain: introduction and examples
3 Markov Chain: limiting probabilities
4 Markov decision process
5 Exponential distribution
6 Poisson process: introduction and examples
7 Poisson process: further properties
8 Poisson process: generalizations
9 Mid term
10 Continuous time Markov Chain: introduction and examples
11 Continuous time Markov Chain: birth and death process
12 Continuous time Markov Chain: limiting probabilities
13 Renewal theory: introduction and examples
14 Renewal theory: relative processes
15 Renewal theory: semi-Markov process
16 Queueing theory: introduction and examples
17 Queueing theory: M/M/1, M/M/s, queueing network
18 Final exam"
content.ch:
"課程簡介：
以機率數量之方法描述與評估具有隨機性之系統〈如生產，製造，服務，通訊系統〉進而可設計系統與最佳化地運作該系統。
先修課程：工程統計 或 統計 或 機率論
課程內容：
1Conditional probability and expectation
2 Markov Chain: introduction and examples
3 Markov Chain: limiting probabilities
4 Markov decision process
5 Exponential distribution
6 Poisson process: introduction and examples
7 Poisson process: further properties
8 Poisson process: generalizations
9 Mid term
10 Continuous time Markov Chain: introduction and examples
11 Continuous time Markov Chain: birth and death process
12 Continuous time Markov Chain: limiting probabilities
13 Renewal theory: introduction and examples
14 Renewal theory: relative processes
15 Renewal theory: semi-Markov process
16 Queueing theory: introduction and examples
17 Queueing theory: M/M/1, M/M/s, queueing network
18 Final exam"

textbook.en: "Textbook: Introduction to Probability Models sixth edition. Sheldon M. Ross Reference: An Introduction to Stochastic Modeling third edition, Howard M. Taylor & S. Karlin"
